reviewText: Countless fans of Boy Meets World have waited 3 years, for Season 4 to be released on DVD.  I hope Walt Disney Studios Home Entertainment and ABC finds an independent company that is willing to re-release the 3 Seasons of Boy Meets World on DVD, and release the 4 remaining Seasons in the near future, very soon.  Please try harder in searching for the right independent.

reviewText: In season two, Corey, Shawn, Topanga, and Eric are thrown into the world of high school with acting principal Mr. Feeny and new characters like Mr. Turner (Anthony Tyler Quinn) Harley Kiner, Frankie and Joey and an assortment of girls that mostly flock to either Shawn or Eric. This season really began to develop the characters in earnest : Topanga became less hippy and more smart though assertive, Shawn became the troubled, but loveable and loyal best friend. Eric devolved into a little bit more goofy though more serious than his later seasons work and Feeny evolved into the stern though prideful principal who could both lay down the law and offer just the slightest few compassionate drops to his students. The extras include more DVD commentaries with Michael Jacobs and usually two cast members which is a big improvement over the first season where they had like five people doing commentary and it got a little messy. On later disks they had picture and picture commentary  on one episode, which was more distracting than anything else.
Title: N/A

reviewText: After awarding the first series of Boy Meets World an unprecedented ten million billion stars it has been brought to my attention that the young lad on the front cover is not Fred Savage but a mere charlatan trying to trick unsuspecting Fred Savage fans like myself into ,erm, enjoying this programme. Please forgive me Fred! I feel violated.
